The one minute 40-second long video was shared here in a Facebook post on March 1, 2020.
Below is a screenshot of the misleading Facebook post:
The post’s English caption reads: “Indian BJP hooligans buried Muslims alive. Sorry it’s painful but we have to spread it all over the world."

The footage and the claim circulated widely in the wake of violent clashes in Delhi, India’s national capital, between February 24-26, 2020. At least 42 people were killed in the unrest which was triggered by India's new citizenship law, AFP reported here.
The same video was also shared on Facebook here, here, here and here; on Twitter here, here, here and here; and on YouTube here and here alongside an identical claim.

The claim is false. Local police told AFP that the video was recorded in January 2020 and shows an exhumation that occurred after a man murdered his wife and two-month-old daughter and buried them in the backyard of their home.
The police also said the incident occurred in Islampur, a town in West Bengal’s North Dinajpur district.

“The incident has nothing to do with the Hindu-Muslim clashes. It was a family matter,” Pintu Barman, the Sub-Inspector at the Islampur Police Station, told AFP by phone on March 3, 2020. “The man’s name was Akbar Alam and he had buried the body of his wife and daughter after killing them following a fight between them on January 30, 2020.”
Barman added that the suspect was arrested, but that he "died in an accident while attempting to escape” from custody.
A Google keyword search found another video showing the same incident published here on YouTube on January 30, 2020.
“A baby and her mother were found buried in Islampur,” says the video’s Bengli caption.
A further Google search found the incident was reported here by a local news website on January 31, 2020.
